page.title: 08KENNELS FARM
page.content: Kennels Farm is so named because it used to house the hunting dogs.Nicola, the cowgirl, has been working there for 3 years. She gets up at 6.00a.m and goes to bed at 9.30p.m.She does at least 12 jobs in a day. Examples are:- Milking Helping to deliver calves. Cleaning out cow sheds. Pasteurising the milk. Feeding and cleaning bulls Helping to make silage. Kennels owns 92 cows and 3 beef bulls and the dung is spread over the fields as manure. The pedigree Jersey cows each produce 15-30 litres of high fat milk daily.The milk has to be sent to Wakefield's Yorkshire Dairies since no other Dairy wants it because it contains alot of fat.When the farmer wants to sell his stock he travels to Crewe.
